verses.kjv: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:
verses.web: Now I Paul, myself, entreat you by the humility and gentleness of Christ, I who in your presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you.
verses.ct: I, Paul, am making a personal appeal to you — and I'm asking with the same humility and gentleness that Christ himself showed. Some of you say I'm timid when I'm there in person but bold when I write from a distance.

verses.kjv: But I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
verses.web: Yes, I beg you that I may not, when present, show courage with the confidence with which I intend to be bold against some, who consider us to be walking according to the flesh.
verses.ct: I'm asking you: please don't force me to be as bold in person as I'm prepared to be against those who accuse us of living by worldly motives.

verses.kjv: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:
verses.web: For though we walk in the flesh, we don’t wage war according to the flesh;
verses.ct: Yes, we live in this world, but we don't fight our battles the way the world does.

verses.kjv: (For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)
verses.web: for the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh, but mighty before God to the throwing down of strongholds,
verses.ct: The weapons we fight with aren't worldly weapons. They carry God's power — strong enough to tear down fortresses.

verses.kjv: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
verses.web: throwing down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ,
verses.ct: We tear down false arguments and every arrogant idea that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take every thought captive and make it obey Christ.

verses.kjv: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.
verses.web: and being in readiness to avenge all disobedience when your obedience is made full.
verses.ct: Once your obedience is complete, we'll be ready to deal with every act of disobedience that remains.

verses.kjv: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he is Christ’s, even so are we Christ’s.
verses.web: Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face? If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ’s, let him consider this again with himself, that even as he is Christ’s, so we also are Christ’s.
verses.ct: You're judging by appearances! If anyone is convinced that they belong to Christ, they need to think again — because we belong to Christ just as much as they do.

verses.kjv: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:
verses.web: For even if I boast somewhat abundantly concerning our authority, which the Lord gave for building you up, and not for casting you down, I will not be ashamed,
verses.ct: Even if I boast a little too much about the authority the Lord gave us, I won't be embarrassed — because he gave it to build you up, not to tear you down.

verses.kjv: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.
verses.web: that I may not seem as if I desire to terrify you by my letters.
verses.ct: I don't want it to seem like I'm just trying to scare you with my letters.

verses.kjv: For his letters, say they, are weighty and powerful; but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.
verses.web: For, “His letters”, they say, “are weighty and strong, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech is despised.”
verses.ct: Some people are saying, "His letters are impressive and forceful, but in person he's unimpressive, and his speaking is terrible."

verses.kjv: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are present.
verses.web: Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such are we also in deed when we are present.
verses.ct: Anyone who says that should understand this: what we say in our letters when we're away is exactly what we'll do when we show up in person.

verses.kjv: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
verses.web: For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves. But they themselves, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are without understanding.
verses.ct: We wouldn't dare put ourselves in the same category as those who promote themselves, or compare ourselves to them. When they measure themselves by their own standards and compare themselves only with each other, they show how foolish they are.

verses.kjv: But we will not boast of things without our measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.
verses.web: But we will not boast beyond proper limits, but within the boundaries with which God appointed to us, which reach even to you.
verses.ct: We won't boast beyond what's appropriate. Instead, we'll stay within the boundaries of the work God assigned to us — and that work includes reaching you.

verses.kjv: For we stretch not ourselves beyond our measure, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in preaching the gospel of Christ:
verses.web: For we don’t stretch ourselves too much, as though we didn’t reach to you. For we came even as far as to you with the Good News of Christ,
verses.ct: We aren't overstepping our boundaries, as if our mission didn't extend to you. After all, we were the first to come all the way to you with the good news of Christ.

verses.kjv: Not boasting of things without our measure, that is, of other men’s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,
verses.web: not boasting beyond proper limits in other men’s labors, but having hope that as your faith grows, we will be abundantly enlarged by you in our sphere of influence,
verses.ct: We don't take credit for work that others have done. Instead, our hope is that as your faith grows, our area of influence among you will expand even further —

verses.kjv: To preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man’s line of things made ready to our hand.
verses.web: so as to preach the Good News even to the parts beyond you, not to boast in what someone else has already done.
verses.ct: so that we can preach the good news in the regions beyond you, rather than boasting about work someone else has already accomplished.

verses.kjv: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
verses.web: But “he who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.”
verses.ct: As Scripture says, "If anyone is going to boast, let them boast in the Lord."

verses.kjv: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.
verses.web: For it isn’t he who commends himself who is approved, but whom the Lord commends.
verses.ct: After all, it's not the person who promotes themselves who is approved — it's the one the Lord promotes.
